page.title: 18Landscape and Buildings 2
page.content: 1 New Farm Barn :C17 possibly with added aisle, evidence for internal partition, alteration and some reused timber 4-bay timber framed and weatherboarded barn with aisle on east with cambered wind braces and queen strut roof. 2 Earthwork in Great Park is the site of a C12 "Deer Hay".In medieval times the wild deer were driven into the stockaded earthwork in the autumn and fed with hay during the winter. There they were culled so ensuring a regular supply of fresh meat through the winter. Now although a historic monu- ment the site is overgrown with mature trees but traces of the ditch and vallum still remain. 3 Swainshill Farm incorporating a C16 cottage named after Mr.William Swain. Mentioned in "The Plough and the Manor" by John Simpson
